name: Short Blades
description: Damage: d6.  Max Block: +1.  Tags: Bladed, 1-Handed, Throwable, Concealable, Backstab.  Examples: Short swords, daggers, kukri, rapiers.

name: Short Blades (Fine)
description: Damage: d8.  Max Block: +1.  Tags: Bladed, 1-Handed, Throwable, Concealable, Backstab.    Examples: Swords, scimitars.

name: Short Blades (Masterwork)
description: Damage: d8+2.  Max Block: +1.  Tags: Bladed, 1-Handed, Throwable, Concealable, Backstab.    Examples: Swords, scimitars.

name: Long Blades
description: Damage: d8.  Max Block: +2.  Tags: Bladed, 1-Handed, 2-Handed.

name: Long Blades (Masterwork)

name: Basic
description: A bundle of 10 arrows.

name: Whistling Ammo
description: Your ammunication makes a loud noise.

name: Blunt Ammo
description: Your Ranged Basic Attacks deal non-lethal damage.

name: Curving Ammo
description: Used with the Curving Ammo Ranged Attack Mod.

name: Barbed Ammo
description: Applies 1 additional Verve Loss.

name: Piercing Ammo
description: Used with the Piercing Ammo Ranged Attack Mod.

name: Splintering Ammo
description: Used with the Splintering Ammo Ranged Attack Mod.

name: Ricocheting Ammo
description: Used with the Ricocheting Ammo Ranged Attack Mod.

name: Elemental Ammo
description: Applies d8 additional Verve Loss.  On critical hits, apply the Elemental Synergy Critical Effect.

name: Clothing
description: Max Dodge: +6.

name: Clothing (Fine)
description: Max Dodge: +7.

name: Clothing (Lavish)
description: Max Dodge: +5.

name: Light Armour
description: Max Block: +1.  Max Dodge: +3.  PDR: 1.

name: Light Armour (Fine)
description: Max Block: +1.  Max Dodge: +4.  PDR: 1.

name: Light Armour (Masterwork)
description: Max Block: +1.  Max Dodge: +4.  PDR: 2.

name: Medium Armour
description: Max Block: +2.  Max Dodge: +2.  PDR: 2.

name: Medium Armour (Fine)
description: Max Block: +2.  Max Dodge: +2.  PDR: 3.

name: Medium Armour (Masterwork)
description: Max Block: +2.  Max Dodge: +2.  PDR: 3.  Free Mod: Hunker Down

name: Heavy Armour
description: Max Block: +3.  Max Dodge: +1.  PDR: 3.  Status: Encumbered.

name: Heavy Armour (Fine)
description: Max Block: +4.  Max Dodge: +2.  PDR: 3.  Status: Encumbered.

name: Heavy Armour (Masterwork)
description: Max Block: +4.  Max Dodge: +2.  UDR: 3.  Status: Encumbered.

name: Shield
description: Max Block: +1.  1-Handed.

name: Shield (Fine)
description: Max Block: +1.  Max Dodge +1.  1-Handed.

name: Shield (Masterwork)
description: Max Block: +1.  Max Dodge +1.  1-Handed.  PDR: 1.

name: Manual Labour
description: Performing a day of manual labour, such as farming, exploring and mercenary work.

name: Skilled Labour
description: Performing a day of skilled labour, such as carpentry.

name: Expert Labour
description: Performing a day of expert labour, such as smithing and alchemy.

name: Mastery Labour
description: Performing a day of master labour, such as enchanting and potion making.

name: Danger Pay (group)
description: Additional pay for dangerous situations.

name: Accommodation (simple)
description: Simple accomodation, such as in a warm barn or threadbare room.

name: Accommodation (comfortable)
description: Standard accommodation, such as in an Inn.

name: Accommodation (lavish)
description: Comfortable accommodation, such as a lavish room in an Inn.

name: Rations
description: Long-life travel rations that substitute all meals for a day.

name: Meal (basic)
description: A basic meal.

name: Meal (lavish)
description: A fantastic multiple-course meal, or a delicate, expensive wine.

name: Alcohol (cheap)
description: A mug of ale, cheap wine or equivalent.

name: Alcohol (expensive)
description: A mug of good ale, renowned wine or equivalent.

name: 1xMapSq (Standard)
description: Travelling by foot or horse.  Expedited travel.  Approximate cost.

name: 1xMapSq (Carriage / Service)
description: Travelling by carriage or transport service.

name: Horse
description: A fine, if not notable, riding horse.  Neigh.

name: Paper, Vellum
description: 5 pages of paper or vellum.

name: Book
description: A basic, and common book.

name: Rope (hemp)
description: A 15m rope that may fray after prolonged use.

name: Rope (silk)
description: Good rope that should last you a while.

name: Backpack
description: A backpack good for adventurers.

name: Item Belt
description: A belt for your quick-use items.  Holds 3.

name: Item Belt (versatile)
description: A belt for your quick-use items.  Holds 4.

name: Reagent (Common)
description: A common alchemical reagent, like Pure Water.

name: Reagent (Uncommon)
description: An uncommon alchemical reagent, like Sapho.

name: Reagent (Rare)
description: A rare alchemical reagent, like Seekhale.

name: Reagent (Rare)
description: A legendary alchemical reagent, like White Flohthinne.

name: Alchemical (DC1)
description: A simple Alchemical, like Vigor Tonic.

name: Alchemical (DC2)
description: A fine Alchemical, like Peptinne.

name: Alchemical (DC3)
description: A lovely Alchemical, like Mediciner’s Solution.

name: Alchemical (DC4)
description: A wonderful Alchemical, like Alchemist's Fire.

name: Alchemical (DC5)
description: A wondrous Alchemical, like Gunpowder.

name: Thieves Tools
description: A concealable kit of lock picks, trap finding tools, and other invaluable tools for those of a rogueish persuasion.

name: Field Engineering Kit
description: A sextant, charcoal, water-level, plum-bob and other invaluable tools for performing field engineering, and engineer crafting of items up to DC 1.

name: Travel Alchemy Set
description: A small pot, reagent tray, cutting and grinding tools, and other implements for crafting Alchemicals up to DC 2.

name: Fine Alchemy Set
description: A burner and stabiliser, medium pot, flexible reagent sorting apparatus, cutting and grinding tools, and other implements for crafting Alchemicals up to DC 3.

name: Instrument (Simple)
description: A simple instrument, such as a lute or flute.

name: Instrument (Lavish)
description: A more advanced instrument such as a harpsichord, or a lavish instrument such as a Fine flute.

name: Amethyst, Agate, Citrine, Garnet, Onyx, Peridot, Rose Quartz
description: Common but lovely gems.

name: Sapphire, Topaz
description: Beautiful, semi-precious gems.

name: Emerald, Ruby, Diamond
description: Precious and outstanding gems.

name: Magic Potions
description: A Magic Potion that replicates the Standard effects of a Spell with a range of Self.  The prive given here is per the level of the Spell.

name: Infusable Seal
description: A runic symbol or Seal that can have magic infused within it.

name: Enchantment, Spell Effect, Activated Charges
description: An item that can be activated for a spell effect a number of times before becoming expended.  To calculate the final price, multiple the given price by the DC of the Spell Effect's level and the number of times the Spell Effect is usable per day.

name: Enchantment, Spell Effect, Activated Daily
description: An item that can be activated for a spell effect a number of times per day.  To calculate the final price, multiple the given price by the DC of the Spell Effect's level and the number of times the Spell Effect is usable per day.

name: Enchantment, Spell Effect, Passive
description: An item that passively and permanently applies a Spell Effect on you.  The price given here is per DC of the Spell Effect.

name: Harriden Hardstone
description: Extremely hardy and strong stone for construction.  Rare.

name: Isleklip
description: A particularly sturdy greystone mined in Emeka.  Isleklip is famed for it’s temperature resistance, keeping warm in winter and cool in summer.  Common.

name: Grindstone
description: Useful stone, usually shipped as small rocks but fashioned into grainy stones, artificial whetstones and other handy honing rocks.  Common.

name: Lanuanite
description: An alloy of [x] and [y], Lanuanite is known to disrupt teleportation magics that occur within 50m.  Very rare.

name: Orraquartz
description: A marbled, clear-pink stone.  Prized by Alchemists and Gadgeteers for its absorbance and sensitivity to Sonic energy.  Uncommon.

name: Kethlite
description: A soft metal used in jewelry and art, and commonly mined around Sim’s Edge.

name: Kendas Crystal
description: An extremely hard semi-transparent stone that shards and breaks into razor-sharp edges.  It is believed that waving this around illusory magics can make the magic waver.  Very Rare.

name: Orrathium
description: An alloy of [x] and [y] that results in a dull black metal that reflects a dark orange colour.  Famed for being resistant to Pyral energy.  Rare.

name: Firestone
description: A strange light rock that, when powered or sandy burns easily.  The act of creating a powder from the rock is very difficult, as the friction can cause it to combust.  Uncommon.

name: Bronsilica
description: A powdery substance which, when mixed correctly with other reagents (including heat) produces a substance with a mild sheen half as shiny as metal, with a resin-like durability.  The final result is mostly Bronsilica, the other reagents are necessary to unlock it’s malleable and shapeable form, otherwise it remains too crystalline.  Due to the rarity of the substance, it is quite expensive and prized.  It is found most commonly in desert climates, and is often found near Callashar.  Rare.

name: Basilica
description: Like Bronsilica, Basilica is a rock which can be broken down into a powdery substance with the right procedures.  It is used in metal alloys and as an alchemical reagent to disrupt other materials - such as reducing the melting point of metals and stones.  Common.

name: Saltine
description: A blue and green flecked granular salt that when used in alchemical recipes can enhance or reduce effects.  Not very palatable, but in its base form is not poisonous.  When mixed with an alcohol can make an excellent light solvent, for cleaning and repairing machinery, armour and weaponry, or lamps and lanterns.  It can also be used as a primer before applying oils.  Common.

name: Tremaxite
description: A deep purple, rocky material that can be burned for energy, and acts as an enhancer for many alloys.  Very Rare.

name: Altsidian
description: A form of tempered volcanic glass much like Obsidian, thought less prone to shattering and which melts at lower temperatures.  It is a man-made construct, being the product of Basilica powder and igneous rock.  Has a curious resistance to Cryonic Energy.  Rare.

name: Saphirium
description: Saphirium is light durable and maintains its form for very long periods.  It excels as a material for making weapons, and most Fine Weapons are made from Saphirium.  When worked, it gains a reflective sheen then when viewed close looks like glitter that reflects white, blue, pink, yellow, and green.  Very Rare.

name: Bronzegold, Polienium
description: These are cheap metals that initially resemble gold and silver, but which tarnish to a duller colour within a few years.  Common.

name: Thunderglass
description: An amber-like glass, fairly waxen and softer than regular glass, created by the unusual combination of sand and minerals and then struck by lightning. Researchers believe this is what makes it resistant to Electric Energy. Some specimens are blue and green, when combined with other mineralis, such as cobaltite (blue) and copper veins (green). Very Rare.

name: Abstrate
description: An alchemical, pink soft crystal that is highly absorbent of liquids like water and non-oily runoff.  It is commonly used in alchemical laboratories to absorb water and other oil-free liquids, for cleaning and safety.  Recently, vast quantities has been found to disrupt mental magics and psionics.  Uncommon.

name: Endelsand
description: A gritty, brown, sandy material used to enhance energies such as flames, which allows for energy levels beyond normal levels.  It is flecked with pinkish-white grains, which act as an easy combustible.  It is difficult, but possible, to work into metals and items.  Uncommon.

name: Scoria
description: A dark volcanic rock made from lava cooling with sand and rock.  Certain specimens have been known to affect Divination Magics and Psionics.  Uncommon.

name: Ebon Scoria
description: A dark, volcanic rock that has cooled over vegetation, creating a uniquely carvable scoria.  While not as hard as metal, it is considered one of the hardest timbers - though whether it is truly a timber or a rock is up for debate.  Rare.

name: Peribeltica
description: An powdery chalky mineral with a blue tinge.  When exposed to different energies, changes its colour, and so is prized for art craft and unique works.  The colour it takes tends to the opposite of the energy applied.  Uncommon.

name: Xirium
description: A golden metal that is very rare and very valuable.  Thought to be metals that are infused with magics during the height of a Flow.  Can be used to create items of wondrous magic, as the metal propagates enchantments better than any other.  Very Rare.

name: Ludmelic Copper
description: A highly reflective copper gold metal that has a mild anti-magic property.  While also disrupting magics generally, it cannot be enchanted, and makes shaping magics more difficult when held to the skin of a magic user.

name: Iron, Copper, etc.
description: Common metals.

name: Steel, Brass, etc.
description: Common alloys.

name: Pendlesteel
description: An alloy of iron and Tremaxite, Pendlesteel is quite durable and enchanters have noted that enhancement magics tend to bond well with it.  Is often used to fashion armours, though due to it being fairly heavy, it is often ringmail, chainmail or fashioned with leathers to reduce the load.  Rare.

name: Cold Iron
description: An iron smelting technique unique to the Erudite Foundation (using a process of heating and super cooling), Cold Iron is cheap to make, extremely durable, but very hard to work with and so the process take a long while - and complex shapes and forms even longer.  For that reason it is used in simple items like boxes and safes, or in simple construction forms like beams and girders.  Uncommon.

name: Leadthought
description: Made by smelting a small amount of Ludmellic Copper with multiple metals.  Prized for its ability to subvert mind controlling magics.  Very Rare.

name: Bismuth Bronze
description: A highly sought after alloy, due to its intense strength, resilience, and resistance to shock.  The secret to creating the alloy is with the Dwarves.  Armours made from the metal are unyielding and harder to wear and even block with, but offer a high Physical Resistance.  Has an unusually orange colour.

name: Ethersteel
description: A formation of steel that is lighter by almost half.  Many have tried to replicate the steel, but the secret is guarded by the Theocratic Confederacy of Sanctuary.  Rumours say that such excellent metalwork can only be under the hands of the dwarves or the elves, but they would need to be particularly pious to align with the confed.
